page.title: 01 Happy Valley,Gwynedd
page.content: The region is dominated by grass, heath and moorland, either enclosed or not but essentially used for sheep farming, large patches of deciduous woods inundate the area, especialy south of the Afon Dysffoyn, Gwyn (Llechwedd Melgh) Many small tributary rivers flow into this main River that runs along Happy Valley, and numerous farmsteads abound. Also included in this section are a disused mine and a Welsh chapel. For the most part the land is rough, grazing land, some parts sheep, others undulating but generally windswept and exposed to the elements. In short, naturally beautiful
